sentences.sentence: Watching the Infanta( 公主 ) from his window, it seemed as if the King could remember his whole married life,
both the great happiness he had felt and his terrible pain at its sudden end.
He held his face in his hands, and when the Infanta( 公主 ) looked up at the window again, the King was gone.
The Infanta( 公主 ) frowned( 皱眉 ) when she saw the empty window and thought, “My father could have at least spent a little time with me on my birthday.
What do his stupid King’s duties matter?
Maybe he has gone to that cold and dark cathedral( 大教堂 ), where the candles are always burning, and where I am never allowed to enter?
How silly of him, when the sun is shining so brightly, and everybody is so happy!”
She just couldn’t understand why her father would miss the children’s bull-fight( 斗牛 ) performance( 表演 ) which was about to start,
as well as the puppet-show( 木偶表演 ) and the other wonderful things.
At least her uncle and the priest( 神父 ) had come out to see her, and wished her a happy birthday.
So she decided not to think about it anymore, and walked down to the end of the garden, to the silk purple tent( 帐篷 ) for her birthday celebrations.
A group of boys came out to meet her, all dressed as bull fighters( 斗牛士 ).
A wonderfully handsome boy of fourteen years old, took her hand and led her inside the tent( 帐篷 ).
He offered her a seat in a special chair, all covered with gold and pearls( 珍珠 ), right next to the raised ring where the pretend( 假装的 ) bull-fight( 斗牛 ) would occur( 发生 ).
The children grouped themselves all around( 聚集...的周围 ) the ring, talking to each other in quiet but excited voices.
Even some of the adults( 成年人 ) had come to watch, and the Infanta( 公主 ) saw her uncle and the priest( 神父 ) standing and laughing at the entrance.
It certainly was a wonderful bull-fight( 斗牛 ), and much nicer, the Infanta( 公主 ) thought, than the real bull-fight( 斗牛 ) that she had seen at Seville( 塞维利亚，地名 ).
Some of the boys pretended( 假装 ) to ride on toy horses, and carried long spears( 长矛 ) with bright ribbons( 丝带 ) tied to them.
Others went on foot, waving( 挥舞 ) their red capes( 披风 ) in front of the bull( 公牛 ), and jumping lightly over the edge of the ring when the bull( 公牛 ) charged( 冲向 ) at them.
As for the bull( 公牛 ) himself, he was just like a live bull( 公牛 ), even though he was only made of sticks and leather( 皮革 ).
Sometimes he even ran around the ring on his back legs, which no live bull( 公牛 ) ever even thinks of doing.
He made it a very good fight, too, and the children were so excited by it that they stood up on their seats and cheered.
At last, however, after a long and heroic fight, the handsome boy asked the Infanta( 公主 )’s permission( 许可 ) to kill the bull( 公牛 ).
She agreed, and so he pushed his wooden sword( 宝剑 ) into the neck of the animal with such force that its head came off.
Inside the headless bull( 公牛 ), everyone could now see the laughing face of a little boy.
Everybody clapped( 鼓掌 ), and then the bull( 公牛 ) was cleared away, and the bull( 公牛 ) fighters all took their seats.
After a short break, some puppets( 木偶 ) appeared on the stage of a small theater that had been built for this purpose.
They then performed( 表演 ) a play, which had a very sad ending.
The puppets( 木偶 ) acted so well, and seemed so real and lifelike( 逼真的 ), that at the end of the play the Infanta( 公主 ) and all the other children had tears( 眼泪 ) in their eyes.
In fact, some of the children really cried.
Even the priest( 神父 ) himself could not help saying to another one of the adults( 成年人 ) how sorry he felt for the puppets, even though he knew they were only made out of wood.
An African magician followed next, and he brought in a large flat basket covered with a red fabric( 布 ).
After placing it in the center of the raised ring, he took out a flute( 长笛 ), and began to play it.
In a few moments the fabric( 布 ) began to move.
As the music grew faster and faster, two green and gold snakes rose slowly up from the basket, and danced to the music.
The children, however, were rather afraid of the snakes, and were much more pleased when the magician performed( 表演 ) some magic tricks( 魔术 ).
When he took the fan of one of the girls, and changed it into a blue bird that flew all around the tent( 帐篷 ) and sang, all of the children laughed and cheered.

article_info.previous: 公主生日的时候，普天同庆，邀请了很多小朋友来王宫玩耍。国王看到快乐的公主，回忆起自己和死去的王后相识相爱的经历，王后去世之后，国王很难过，不理朝政，不再娶妻。
article_info.share_words: Watching the Infanta from his window, it seemed as if the King could remember his whole married life, both the great happiness he had felt and his terrible pain at its sudden end.

options.cn: 因为她的父亲在她生日当天都没能花点儿时间陪她。
options.en: Because her father didn't spend a little time with her on her birthday.
Because her father didn't love her.

options.cn: 因为她想起了她的母亲。

analysis: 文中提到：“The Infanta frowned when she saw the empty window and thought, ‘My father could have at least spent a little time with me on my birthday.’”因此本题选A。

question.cn: 公主觉得斗牛表演如何？
question.en: What did the Infanta think of the bull-fight?

options.cn: 没有她在塞维利亚看的精彩。
options.en: It was not as good as the real bull-fight she saw in Seville.
It was much nicer than the real bull-fight.

analysis: 文中提到：“It certainly was a wonderful bull-fight, and much nicer, the Infanta thought, than the real bull-fight that she had seen at Seville. ”公主认为比她在塞维利亚看的真正斗牛还好看，因此本题选B。

question.cn: 为什么公主和王子眼里含着泪水？
question.en: Why did the Infanta and other children have tears in their eyes?

options.en: Because the puppets were so poor.

options.cn: 因为木偶剧让公主想起了母亲。
options.en: Because the play reminded the Infanta of her mother.

options.cn: 因为木偶剧的结局很悲伤。
options.en: Because the ending of the play was so sad.

analysis: 文中提到：“They then performed a play, which had a very sad ending. The puppets acted so well, and seemed so real and lifelike, that at the end of the play the Infanta and all the other children had tears in their eyes.”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 木偶剧结束后接下来的表演是什么？
question.en: What was the next performance after the play?

analysis: 文中提到：“An African magician followed next, and he brought in a large flat basket covered with a red fabric. ”魔术师登场，可知接下来是魔术表演，因此本题选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第40天
